adjective.description: (of a railroad, especially one on a mountainside) operating by cable with ascending and descending cars counterbalanced.
Relating to a rope or its tension.

noun.description: A cable railroad, especially one on a mountainside, in which ascending and descending cars are counterbalanced.

origin: Mid 17th century (in the sense of or like a cord or thread): from Latin funiculus (diminutive of funis rope) + -ar.
